subject: Cooking
title: Double-Dipping: How Bad Is It Really?
description: Learn Double-Dipping: How Bad Is It Really? in one minute.

hook.text: Seinfeld made double-dipping a social crime. Scientists decided to check if the outrage was justified.

buildup.text: Clemson University tested double-dipping chips into salsa, chocolate sauce, and cheese dip.

discovery.text: Double-dipping transferred about 1,000 bacteria per milliliter of dip â€” roughly 5x more than single-dipping.

twist.text: Acidic dips like salsa killed most transferred bacteria within 2 hours. Cheese dip preserved them longer.

climax.text: The risk is real but tiny â€” you'd need a sick person double-dipping to pose any real health threat.

punchline.text: Double-dipping is gross etiquette. It's barely a health issue.
